profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid encoded by Library of Congress Music Division, 2005

change.item: Editorial revisions made to this finding aid by Nancy Seeger in March 2010.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Primarily correspondence from, among others, Ferruccio Busoni, Teresa Careño, Percy Grainger, and Moriz Rosenthal. Also photographs, many with autograph inscriptions including those of Claude Debussy, Victor Herbert, and John McCormack. Music is represented by manuscripts and autographed presentation scores (printed). The ramainder consists of miscellaneous personal papers, programs, and clippings.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Given to the Library by Gunn's daughters, Janet Gunn McLean and Nancy Stephens in 1971.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Glenn Dillard Gunn Collection was processed by Timothy Bullard in 1992 under the direction of Claudia Widgery and Robert Saladini. The finding aid was originally created with Word Perfect 5.1 software. In 2002, Michael A. Ferrando prepared and edited the finding aid in order to prepare it for the present EAD format.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The status of copyright on the materials of the Glenn Dillard Gunn Collection is governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.).

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The Glenn Dillard Gunn Collection is open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Performing Arts Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use. Certain restrictions to use or copying of materials may apply.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: container number, Glenn Dillard Gunn Collection, Music Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Glenn Dillard Gunn, 1874-1963, music critic and pianist; music critic of Chicago tribune, Chicago herald examiner, and Washington times-herald.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Glenn Dillard Gunn Collection consists primarily of Correspondence, Photographs, and Music. The range of dates represented in the collection is 1874-1961.

Worthy of note in the collection are letters from correspondents such as Ferruccio Busoni, Teresa Carreño, Percy Grainger, and Moriz Rosenthal. There are also numerous photographs with autograph inscriptions to the Gunns, including those of Claude Debussy, Victor Herbert, and John McCormack. The sizable collection of printed music includes a number of autographed presentation scores, such as Eric Delamarter's Suite from The Black Orchid and Symphony no. 3, and Moriz Rosenthal's Zehn CharakterStücke. The manuscript music in Gunn's own hand consists of an arrangement of J. S. Bach's English Suite no. 3 for winds and a transcription of a Bach keyboard concerto for three pianos. A manuscript of several songs from the Gitanjali cycle by John Alden Carpenter, though in the hand of a copyist, does include Carpenter's own pencilled indications of orchestration.
The remainder of the collection consists of miscellaneous personal papers, programs and clippings.

arrangement.head: Organization of the Glenn Dillard Gunn Collection
arrangement.p: The Glenn Dillard Gunn Collection is organized in 7 series:

scopecontent.p: Articles for the All-American Youth Orchestra (1940), a Diary , a letter to Lucy Furman (1955), and an undated typescript article.

did.unittitle:
Articles for series on the Leopold Stokowski All-American Youth Orchestra tour of South America, July 31 - September 4, 1940, arranged chronologically (typescript drafts)
See also: CLIPPINGS
Letter to Lucy Furman ("Cousin Pearl"), dated June 28, 1955

scopecontent.p: Letters to Glenn Dillard Gunn. The bulk date of these letters is from 1949-1955.
Miscellaneous personal documents (including school report card, temperance pledges, church tribute, etc.).

arrangement.p: Arrangement is alphabetical by general description of each item.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous personal documents (including school report card, temperance pledges, church tribute, etc.)

arrangement.p: Arrangement is by genre and then by date.

did.unittitle: Programmes for the Summer Season, 1874 [by] Theodore Thomas. [Bound volume given by Thomas to Milman Adams on March 12th, 1883; given by Adams to Glenn Dillard Gunn on May 12, 1910]

scopecontent.p: Reviews and articles written by Gunn dated from 1902-1940.

did.unittitle: Reviews by Gunn and press notices on recitals and lectures, 1902- (in bound scrapbook)
Reviews and articles by Gunn, 1905 (in 3-ring notebook)
Reviews of Gunn's performances written by others
Series of articles by Gunn on the Leopold Stokowski All-American Youth Orchestra tour of South America (1940)

scopecontent.p: Photographs taken of Glenn Dillard and others. Many of these photographs have inscriptions to Gunn, his wife (Bernya Bracken Gunn) or his daughter (Janet Gunn).

note.p: photo of portrait owned by William F. Scheide

scopecontent.p: The Music series is represented by two subseries. The first subseries is Manuscript music collected by Glenn Dillard Gunn. The second subseries is Printed music collected by Glenn Dillard Gunn.

arrangement.p: Arrangement is genre, composer or arranger and title.
